summary:
Proteins are large biomolecules made of amino acids linked together like a chain. They do many jobs in our bodies, like speeding up chemical reactions (enzymes), giving cells their shape, and fighting infections.

The order of amino acids in a protein determines its unique 3D shape, which decides its job. Sometimes, proteins have extra helper molecules attached, called prosthetic groups.

Proteins don't last forever; they get broken down and recycled by our cells.
title: Protein
